org.gearvrf.utility

Interface Threads.ThreadPolicyProvider<CANCELABLE extends Threads.Cancelable>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Threads.LifoThreadPolicyProvider
    Enclosing class:
    Threads

    public static interface Threads.ThreadPolicyProvider<CANCELABLE extends Threads.Cancelable>
    Manages pool of pending threads, deciding which should run next. Used in conjunction with a ThreadLimiter, which handles synchronization: implementations generally don't need to pay attention to thread safety.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Runnable get()
      Returns the next thread proc.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Are there any thread procs in the pool? May use Threads.Cancelable.stillWanted() to trim pool.
      void put(CANCELABLE threadProc)
      Add a thread proc to the pool
      void reschedule(CANCELABLE threadProc)
      Make threadProc the next in the pool.

    • Method Detail

      • put

        void put(CANCELABLE threadProc)
        Add a thread proc to the pool

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Are there any thread procs in the pool? May use Threads.Cancelable.stillWanted() to trim pool.

      • get

        java.lang.Runnable get()
        Returns the next thread proc. May return null or raise exception if isEmpty() is true

      • reschedule

        void reschedule(CANCELABLE threadProc)
        Make threadProc the next in the pool.
        • If threadProc is already in the pool, move it to the front, so get() returns it next.
        • If threadProc is not in the pool, add it at the front, so get() returns it next.
